<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Discerning Strike](/Feats.aspx?ID=2274) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [PFS Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=50) pg. 119</row>

**Archetype** [Pathfinder Agent](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=13)

**Prerequisites**
[Pathfinder Agent Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=871); [Thorough Reports](/Feats.aspx?ID=874)

**Requirements**
You have successfully identified the target with [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) during this combat.

</column>

---

Identifying a creature is the first step in finding its weaknesses. Attempt a Strike against the target; if successful, you deal an additional 1d6 precision damage. If you have succeeded on a Recall Knowledge check against the target during this combat and their creature type was previously recorded using [Thorough Reports](/Feats.aspx?ID=874), you also deal 1 point of [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). The creature is then temporarily immune to Discerning Strike for 1 day.

<title level="2">Swords Training</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [PFS Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=50) pg. 119</row>

Marcos Farabellus (_Lost Omens Pathfinder Society Guide_ page 50) is a talented swordsman and likely the most beloved of the Society's three deans. In addition to teaching his students about the dangers of exploring ruins through energetic and performative lectures, Farabellus also teaches his favorite students a few of the martial techniques he's developed over his illustrious career. The Farabellus Flip is a class feat for barbarians, fighters, or rangers. When you select the feat, it loses the traits from the other classes.

**Related Feats**: [Farabellus Flip](/Feats.aspx?ID=2275)
